definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.chinese: 不扣衣領最上面的鈕釦。

sentences.english: Lipstick on Her Collar? Men Say, ‘O.K.’
sentences.chinese: 她衣領上有脣印？男士說，“沒關係”。

sentences.english: Many people who see head collars mistake them for muzzles .
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲頭部衣領以爲他們的口套。

sentences.english: There was a speck of blood on his collar.
sentences.chinese: 他的衣領上有一點血斑。

sentences.english: Okay, collar boy, let's see what you got.
sentences.chinese: 好的，衣領小子，讓我們看看你有什麼本事。

sentences.english: At the other end of the spectrum are the "gold-collar" workers.
sentences.chinese: 衣領暗碼光譜的另一端則是“金領”上班族。

sentences.english: Ben was so indignant that be seized the man by the collar.
sentences.chinese: 本氣極了，揪住了那個人的衣領。

sentences.english: The girl's shirt collar is laced.
sentences.chinese: 女孩的襯衣衣領飾有花邊。

sentences.english: Pullover tunic flaunts a point collar and open half placket.
sentences.chinese: 套衫中山裝標榜點衣領和開半門襟。

sentences.english: Thin padded tongue and collar to keep it soft when you're on-the-go.
sentences.chinese: 舌苔薄軟墊和衣領，保持柔軟當你在走。

sentences.english: It is so hot inside. Please turn down your coat collar.
sentences.chinese: 裏面太熱了，請把大衣領翻下。

sentences.english: What will your relatives say to see me in a crumpled collar? Do speak!
sentences.chinese: 您的家長看見我的衣領都揉皺了，該怎麼說呀？

sentences.english: Sleeves, collars and trouser cuffs are colorfully trimmed.
sentences.chinese: 在袖子，衣領和褲子的翻邊處有色彩鮮豔的點綴。

sentences.english: Mesh lining with extra padding at the tongue and collar.
sentences.chinese: 網在舌頭和衣領微胖的襯裏。

sentences.english: It is actually a 3mm collar which can be fit into the main shaft.
sentences.chinese: 它實際上是一3毫米衣領可融入主井。

sentences.english: Black faux-fur jacket has a shawl collar.
sentences.chinese: 黑色人造毛皮夾克連披肩衣領。

definition: collar/neckband/neckline/the place where the two ends of a collar meet
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
